title: Sylvester Mittee
text:
Sylvester "The Master Blaster" Mittee (born 29 October 1956) is a <a href="Demographics%20of%20Saint%20Lucia">Saint Lucian</a> British <a href="Boxing">boxer</a> of the 1970s and 1980s. He fought as an <a href="amateur">amateur</a> <a href="lightweight">lightweight</a> and a <a href="professional">professional</a> <a href="light%20welterweight">light welterweight</a>/<a href="welterweight">welterweight</a>/<a href="light%20middleweight">light middleweight</a>, winning multiple championships.
Boxing career.
As an amateur, Mittee won the 1973 <a href="Amateur%20Boxing%20Association%20of%20England">Amateur Boxing Association of England</a> (ABAE) Junior Class-B title, while boxing for Crown and Manor ABC, <a href="Hoxton">Hoxton</a>, London. He subsequently won the 1976 ABAE lightweight title against <a href="Thomas%20McCallum">Thomas McCallum</a> (Sparta BC) while boxing for Repton Amateur Boxing Club, <a href="Bethnal%20Green">Bethnal Green</a>, London.
Mittee represented Great Britain at the <a href="1976%20Summer%20Olympics">1976 Summer Olympics</a> in <a href="Montreal%2C%20Quebec">Montreal, Quebec</a>, Canada, competing as a <a href="Boxing%20at%20the%201976%20Summer%20Olympics%20%E2%80%93%20Lightweight">lightweight in the boxing events</a>. After a bye in the round of 64, his sole fight was a loss to <a href="Simion%20Cu%C5%A3ov">Simion Cuţov</a> of Romania, the eventual <a href="silver%20medal">silver medal</a>ist, in the round of 32; the referee stopped the contest in the third round.
As a professional, Mittee won the <a href="British%20Boxing%20Board%20of%20Control">British Boxing Board of Control</a> (BBBofC) Southern (England) Area light welterweight title, the BBBofC British welterweight title and <a href="List%20of%20Commonwealth%20Boxing%20Council%20Champions%23welterweight">Commonwealth welterweight title</a>, and was a challenger for the BBBofC British light welterweight title against <a href="Clinton%20McKenzie">Clinton McKenzie</a>, and <a href="European%20Boxing%20Union">European Boxing Union</a> (EBU) welterweight title against <a href="Lloyd%20Honeyghan">Lloyd Honeyghan</a>.
